EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0)
 – Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0) operating with fuel Inventory({'coal': 8}) and a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5).
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0)
 – Stone Furnace at (5.0, 0.0) with fuel Inventory({'coal': 4}) and a Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5).
• Common Input Chest:
 – Wooden Chest at (2.5, 0.5) stocking copper-plate.
• New Feeder Inserter:
 – Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5).
• Transport Belt Connection:
 – BeltGroup linking mining output at (-14.5, -47.5) to feeder inserter pickup at (2.5, -1.5) using 64 belts.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at position (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0)
 – Operates with fuel Inventory({}) and now shows warnings updated to ['out of fuel'].
• Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5)
 – Configured with pickup at (-12.5, -47.5) and drop at (-14.5, -47.5).
• Belt Network:
 – Transport Belt at (-14.5, -48.5) has now been successfully placed after the player moved close.
 – Additional belt segments include:
  • Transport belt at (-15.5, -48.5) and a belt at (-16.5, -48.5) with spacing=1.
  • BeltGroup Segment A running from (-16.5, -48.5) to (-16.5, -47.5) (comprising 6 belts).
  • BeltGroup Segment B2 connecting (-15.5, -47.5) to the smelting network input at (-14.5, -47.5) (WORKING); Segment B1 remains unestablished.
• Output Extraction Setup:
 – Output Inserter placed at (-13.5, -48.5) (after removal of a conflicting belt) with pickup at (-12.5, -48.5) and drop at (-14.5, -48.5); it has been rotated so that its pickup face points LEFT.
 – Attempts to place an adjacent output chest (for ore collection) have failed due to collision with an existing transport belt.
 – Subsequent attempts to craft and place an additional burner-inserter under varied spacing (spacing=1 and spacing=2) were also unsuccessful because of positional conflicts at (-12.5, -48.5) and (-11.5, -48.5).

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Placement Range and Proximity:
 – When placement fails because the player is too far (e.g. transport belt or attempting to shift an inserter), ensure the player is moved within the maximum allowed distance before placing.
• Collision and Spacing Conflicts:
 – Verify that the target tile is free from other entities before placing items like output inserters or output chests. Adjust spacing, direction, or reference position to avoid clashes with existing transport belts or inserters.
• Belt Connection Validity:
 – When attempting to join belt segments, ensure there is an unobstructed, continuous path between the source and destination. Errors in connecting segments indicate invalid or blocked paths.
• Inventory Verification:
 – Confirm that required items (for example, burner-inserters) are available in the inventory prior to repositioning or placement actions.
• Entity Removal and Downstream Effects:
 – If a conflicting entity (such as a transport belt) is removed to clear the placement area, ensure no residual conflicts remain that might prevent subsequent placements.

NAMESPACE
─────────
shift_entity_local(entity: Entity, offset: Tuple[float, float]) -> Entity
 • Shifts the given entity’s position locally by the specified offset.
  – Previously used successfully; note potential repositioning issues.
Important Variables:
• furnace_input_chest_pos (Position) – holds the position of the furnace’s input chest.
• current_player_inventory (Inventory) – tracks the player’s inventory state.
